resources.string: What does the running count tell you?
"•\tStrategy used for blackjack to determine the ratio of high cards vs. low cards that remain in the deck over the course of a game.
• The running count is a value that starts at 0.
• Each card has an assigned value that varies by card counting system. Swipe left to view the different systems.
• All you need to do is add the value of each opened card to the running count. \nFor example:
• The running count in the case is +1.
• If the running count is positive, then there are more high cards than low cards, you are at an advantage again the dealer.
• If the running count is negative then there are more low cards that high cards, the dealer has an advantage over you.
• When the running count is +2 you should start increasing your bet.
• When playing with multi-deck, making betting judgement using just the running count is insufficient. You need to do: \n Running Count / (# Deck Starts - #Decks Left)
